data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كُنْتُمْ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: early part of morning, morrow, morning, time between the prayer of daybreak and sunrise, first part of the day
data.sentence: The word اغْدُوا comes from the root غ د و and is associated with the meanings: early part of morning, morrow, morning, time between the prayer of daybreak and sunrise, first part of the day

data.meanings: To till and sow, cultivate, cut a thing, acquire (goods), plough, study a thing thoroughly.Harth has the meanings; Gain, acquisition, reward (gain), recompense (gain), seed-produce, what is grown/raised by means of seed/date-stones/planting. A wife or road that is much trodden.
data.sentence: The word حَرْثِكُمْ comes from the root ح ر ث and is associated with the meanings: To till and sow, cultivate, cut a thing, acquire (goods), plough, study a thing thoroughly.Harth has the meanings; Gain, acquisition, reward (gain), recompense (gain), seed-produce, what is grown/raised by means of seed/date-stones/planting. A wife or road that is much trodden.

data.meanings: to cut off, reap, pluck, be broken, gather (fruit), trim. saarim - one who cuts or gathers (fruit). sariim - garden whose fruit has all been cut, dark night as though it were burnt up and black.
data.sentence: The word صَارِمِينَ comes from the root ص ر م and is associated with the meanings: to cut off, reap, pluck, be broken, gather (fruit), trim. saarim - one who cuts or gathers (fruit). sariim - garden whose fruit has all been cut, dark night as though it were burnt up and black.
